availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Hodges (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Green County, Kentucky, native. Married to Sarah D. Biggs Hodges in Green County, Kentucky, on September 11, 1845. Father of Mary E. Hodges, Martha J. Hodges, John W. Hodges, Sarah W. Hodges, Rebecca F. Hodges, Thomas J. Hodges, Samuel A. Hodges, and Emily C. Hodges. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Green County in 1860.
